Title: Eid-El-Kabir: Prophet Olu Alo tasks Nigerians on unity, love
Summary: Nigerians urged to renew commitment to national unity . Prophet Olu Alo tasks Nigerians on unity, love . Alo urges Nigerians to renew their commitment to unity .

Title: Lagos-Calabar project: Afenifere faction demands Tinubu’s impeachment
Summary: A faction of the pan-Yoruba socio-political group, Afenifere, is seeking immediate impeachment proceedings against President Bola Tinubu . The group is seeking to impeach the president over the Lagos-Calabar project .

Title: Silk Road Pop-Up Book: Integrating history, modern technology
Summary: Silk Road Pop-Up Book: Integrating history, modern technology . With excitement over a fresh innovation and technological breakthrough, the International Department of the Communist Party of China (CPC)

Title: ‘I feel addicted to music’ — Chella on his Afro-fusion rise and reign
Summary: Chella is fast becoming one of Afrobeats' most exciting breakout voices . In this interview with Guardian Music, the singer talks about his viral hit My Darling .

Title: Our churches unjustly demolished in Lagos — Deeper Life
Summary: The Deeper Life Bible Church has accused Lagos State government agencies of unlawfully demolishing several of its properties across the state . The church described the actions as unjust and indicative of systematic harassment .

Title: 35 Nigerians deported from Ireland for breaching immigration laws
Summary: 35 Nigerians deported from Ireland for breaching immigration laws . Among those deported were five children and nine women, with officials clarifying that the children were part of family groups .

Title: No rift with Ooni of Ife, says Alaafin amid visit to Oluwo
Summary: The Alaafin of Oyo, Oba Abimbola Owoade, has dismissed reports of a rift between himself and the Ooni of Ife . Oba Adeyeye Enitan Ogunwusi was visiting Oluwo at the weekend .

Title: Sallah: NAF airstrikes ‘foil terror plot’ in Borno
Summary: The Nigerian Air Force said on Saturday that it’s fighter aircraft, in a series of precision airstrikes conducted on 5 and 6 June 2025, decimated key Boko Haram hideouts at Tumbumma Baba and Chiralia in Borno State .

Title: Trader sues NAFDAC N110m for allegedly ‘looting’ her shop at Onitsha drug market
Summary: Ms. Sophia Eberechukwu Okoye, a trader in clothing materials at the Bridgehead drug market, Onitsha (Ogbo Ogwu) has filed a N110 million civil suit against the National Agency for Food, Drugs and Administration and Control, NAFDAC, for allegedly looting her shop .

Title: Sultan urges prayers for Nigeria’s progress
Summary: Alh. Sa’ad Abubakar urged traditional rulers to pray for Nigeria . He made the appeal after leading a special prayer following Jumu’at prayer, conducted by Sheikh Bello Akwara, Chief Imam of Sultan Bello Mosque, on Friday .

Title: I won't be at Club World Cup, says Portugal's Ronaldo
Summary: Cristiano Ronaldo confirms he will not play in the upcoming Club World Cup . Portugal captain says suggestions he was set to take part in the competition are wide of the mark . Ronaldo's contract at Saudi side Al-Nassr is set to expire at the end of June . Portugal face Spain in the Nations League final against Germany in Munich

Title: Nigeria drifting towards dictatorship if not checked, Ozekhome warns
Summary: Renowned Nigerian constitutional lawyer and human rights advocate, Professor Mike Ozekhome, (SAN), has issued a warning that Nigeria is “gradually driving without knowing it towards a one-party state,” a trajectory he believes could lead to full-blown dictatorship if not actively resisted by the populace . Title: Tottenham Hotspur's Son praises sacked Postecoglou as legend
Summary: Tottenham Hotspur's Greek-Australian Head Coach Ange Postecoglou was sacked as manager on Friday . The 59-year-old Australian guided Tottenham to a 1-0 victory over Manchester United in the Europa League final last month to clinch the club’s first European prize in 41 years and secure a place in next season�

Title: Nigeria’s great folklorist: Tinubu mourns 'Gwo Gwo' crooner Ejeagha
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has reacted to the passing of veteran highlife musician and folklorist Mike Ejeagha . The President described the musician as “one of Nigeria’s greatest folklorists, songwriters, and musicians in the Igbo language . He also offered prayers for the peaceful repose of E

Title: Foreign affairs ministry alerts public to fake Facebook account
Summary: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs has issued a warning in Abuja about the creation of a fake Facebook account in the name of its Permanent Secretary, Amb. Dunoma Ahmed . “The Ministry firmly disassociates itself from this impersonation and urges the public to disregard any messages from the fake account, which is not an official channel
